page.title: 07A MENDIP SHEEP FARMER
page.content: One farmer rears sheep on the remote mendip plateau.He does not have a set pattern for 5 days a week.His job is very seasonal.Basically he works while its light.From November to February he will usually start work at 8.30 and finish at 5.00.In summer he usually gets up early.But one of the advantages is that he can plan his own day. Lambing in February is his busiest time,and heavy snow can cause additional problems.He has been cut off by drifts.Much of his land is rocky with thin soils,not suitable for crops. One of his favourite hobbies is flying his microlight.He flies this at weekends.
